IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We have identified that a piece of electrical safety equipment called a cut out needs replacing because the equipment is coming to the end of its serviceable life. This equipment is the link between our electricity network and a property's internal wires. We appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. Once complete, the work will ensure that the property is connected safely to our electricity network. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and replace the cut out. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. This work is taking place at a property on Long Mill Lane

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Chalk Farm Lane and Debden Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 28 poles that need replacing and upgrading and 2 poles that need to be refurbished. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our contractors will be in the area from the 5th January delivering poles, materials and the generators. Tree trimming will also be carried out during this time. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. Please could solar panels be isolated for the duration of the works. This work is taking place in several locations in Slough Road, School Road, Barnston Road and Poplar Road.

This work is taking place on Woodlands Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near The Fitches.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 01:27 - We can now confirm that all power in the Sherbourne Close area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault, which our engineers repaired.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Sherbourne Close area and have restored power to a further 11 properties.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Kevin at 00:43.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Kevin at 22:50 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We know your power may now be back on, however; we'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 17:38 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 19:49 - We can now confirm that all power in the NR12 0 / NR28 9 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted as much power as they can. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used  temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the NR12 0 / NR28 9 area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Kevin at 19:04.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 18:25 - Our engineers have completed their investigations.

There's going to be a lot of work required to repair the issue safely, so we have decided to use temporary generators to provide power. To allow time for us to get the generators out to your area and connect them, we may need to adjust our estimated time frame of 18:30-19:30. 

We will let you know when they arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 14:45 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Studley Road area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Just to let you know our staff have now arrived back on site in the Studley Road area. They are going to test our equipment thoroughly to check if the underlying issue can be located before they attempt to restore your power again.

I know having power cuts this often must be causing you a lot of problems, and our staff are doing everything they can to keep the power on. Our time frame remains unchanged, and we're keeping in contact with our staff regularly to make sure you have the best information to plan ahead.

I'll update you as soon as we hear more from them. Sent by Theo at 14:09.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:43 - We're sorry your power has gone off again today. Our engineers investigated the fault earlier but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 03:42 - We can now confirm that all power in the Arles Avenue area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault. Although we have been able to restore power, there is further work required to repair the cable.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 02:54 - Thanks for bearing with us over tonight. Our team of cable jointers have identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team will excavate the underground network fault so that we can carry out repairs and restore power. This can take some time depending on the surface material, and how much space is needed to allow our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely. 

Our estimated time frame of 04:30 and 05:30 doesn't need to change currently. We'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Lisa at 22:34 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Risgeway Road area again.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 20:11 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 08:28 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that they are due back on site shortly to continue with the repairs to the underground cable fault, they've advised a new time of 11:00-12:00 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.

Sent by Lisa at 02:37 - We can now confirm that all power in the School Lane area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Kevin at 01:45 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Sent by Lisa at 22:30 - We can now confirm that all power in the Dunbar Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Theo at 21:56.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Dunbar Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 23:34 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 549 customers in the Lewes BN8 5 area, by diverting power around an underground network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Kevin at 22:46 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 113 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 278 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Kevin from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience tonight, our field staff and control room engineers are working/have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 22:07. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Our engineers had to redirect power due to a fault on the electricity network.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Kevin at 23:34 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 549 customers in the Lewes BN8 5 area, by diverting power around an underground network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Sent by Kevin at 22:46 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 113 properties still affected.

They have managed to get a further 278 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised.

If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on.

To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 01:53 - We can now confirm that all power in the Chase Side area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Chase Side area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 03:30 and 04:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Lisa at 00:59.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 00:10 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Chase Side area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 03:30 and 04:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 01:50 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Tithe Farm area should now be back on.

Our staff have restored your power by replacing our substation safety equipment. Following the results of their tests, the underground cable fault we believe is causing these issues has not yet become visible, so for the moment we have restored your power as fast as possible.

I'm very sorry for the continued disruption, but this may happen again before we're able to fix it. If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 00:49 - Our staff are on the way to the Tithe Farm area, as our substation equipment has operated again. Our current estimated time frame to restore power is between 04:00 and 05:00, but this is based on our staff being able to restore your power by replacing the substation equipment.

As this has happened several times recently, it indicates a cabling fault. This may have reached a point where our safety equipment will not replace safely, meaning the fault has become visible. If this happens, we'll arrange further specialist teams to attend and repair it. I'll keep you updated.

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Lenham Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 0930 -1030  hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Lee at 06:30.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of engineers are on their way. Based on what we know about the issue so far, and to allow them time to arrive and carry out tests and checks on the network, we've changed the estimated time to between 0930 - 1030

We're sorry for the delay, but we'll let you know when they arrive and we'll keep you updated with progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to help on 105. Sent by Lee at 06:09.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 03:36 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers divert power on the underground network in the North Park Lane area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the North Park Lane area to investigate the power cut affecting 9 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Lisa at 03:22.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lisa at 02:50 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground network fault that initially interrupted power to 1550 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 9 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 04:30 and 05:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 02:30. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 10:04 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that to enable them to continue to work on the underground cable fault safely, they will need to turn more power off in the area. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 14:30 and 15:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Bev at 08:20 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We have further specialist teams and equipment on site, and we're now estimating to have all power back on between 10:30 and 11:30. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 09:39 - Thanks for your patience over today; I'll be on hand to update you as our staff work on repairs, and I just wanted to give you the latest from site. We can now confirm that a fault on an underground cable in the St. Johns Road, TN6 1 area is causing safety equipment on our network to operate. Although we know what's causing your power cut, we still need to locate the fault. To do this we're sending specialist teams and equipment, once they are on their way we'll be able to advise a new estimated time frame for power to be restored. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lee at 09:17 -We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 08:45 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the St. Johns Road, TN6 1 area, the estimated time of 200 - 1300 hasn't changed. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Logs.Comment:
Sent by Talie at 09:56 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Chase Side area, the estimated time of 11:30-12:30 hasn't changed.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can.

Steps.Message:

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.

Logs.Comment:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.

Sent by Lee at 09:56 - Our staff are on the way to the RH8 0 RH8 9 area, as our substation equipment has operated again. Our current estimated time frame to restore power is between 1400 - 1500 but this is based on our staff being able to restore your power by replacing the substation equipment.

As this has happened several times recently, it indicates a cabling fault. This may have reached a point where our safety equipment will not replace safely, meaning the fault has become visible. If this happens, we'll arrange further specialist teams to attend and repair it. I'll keep you updated.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Fuse Replacement/Linking affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 07-JAN-2026 14:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Oakdene Park, N3 1 area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Talie at 09:48.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 09:40 - Our staff are on the way to the N3 1 area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 13:00 and 14:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Alert from UK Power Networks at [TIME]

We own and maintain the electrical cabling and substations in London, East Anglia, and the Southeast. Due to a safety issue, we may need to switch off some power in the [postcode] area.

We usually provide advance notice for maintenance power cuts, but this is due to an unexpected network issue that could affect public safety.

Your power may not go off, but for more information, call us on 08003163105 (press the option for power cuts) and quote our reference [INCIDENTID].

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
